conclusion: Shadows are cast in the opposite direction of the light source.
If the light moves to the back right, shadows will move towards the front left.
A (cake) shadow is to the bottom right.
B (needle) shadow is to the bottom right.
C (bandage) shadow is to the right.
D (ring) shadow is to the bottom right.
A (cake) shadow will move towards the bottom left.
B (needle) shadow will move towards the front left.
C (bandage) shadow will move towards the front left.
D (ring) shadow will move towards the front left.
The size of a shadow can increase if the light source moves closer to the object.
Assume the size remains relatively constant unless specified.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will all shift towards the front left when the light source moves to the back right.
The shadows A, B, C, and D will move towards the front left, and their sizes will remain relatively unchanged unless the distance to the light source also changes.
